issue.title: ManagedCamelContext dump stats methods do not work in native mode
issue.body:
### Bug description

`ManagedCamelContext` methods `dumpRouteStatsAsXml` & `dumpStepStatsAsXml` throw an exception in native mode. Likely there is some configuration missing in the management extension to make it work.

```
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Not Implemented in native mode
	at java.management@21.0.2/javax.management.JMX.createProxy(JMX.java:19)
	at java.management@21.0.2/javax.management.JMX.newMBeanProxy(JMX.java:216)
	at java.management@21.0.2/javax.management.MBeanServerInvocationHandler.newProxyInstance(MBeanServerInvocationHandler.java:240)
	at org.apache.camel.management.DefaultManagementAgent.newProxyClient(DefaultManagementAgent.java:396)
	at org.apache.camel.management.mbean.ManagedCamelContext.dumpRoutesStatsAsXml(ManagedCamelContext.java:646)
```

body: Does native image support JMX now?

Yes, partial Native Image support for remote JMX connections has been added. However, currently only platform MXBeans and standard MBeans are supported (not model or dynamic mbeans). With respect to platform MXbeans, not all attributes and functionality is implemented (much is, but there are still things missing like accessing ThreadInfo from the ThreadMXBean). 

`JMX.createProxy` gets called from `JMX.newMBeanProxy`, which I believe only accepts standard MBeans. So I **think** what you are trying to do should work. Maybe this Quarkus substitution is out-of-date and is no longer necessary. 

Let me do a check for myself, then I will follow up again here.

The [docs are here](https://www.graalvm.org/latest/reference-manual/native-image/guides/build-and-run-native-executable-with-remote-jmx/) if you haven't found them already.

I tried out using `JMX.newMBeanProxy` with a sample client/server (both native images). I can confirm that it works as expected with a standardMBean as long as the corresponding dynamic proxy reflection configuration is provided.  I believe that the Quarkus substitution is no longer needed.

issue.title: Make substitution of JMX#createProxy conditional on inclusion of jmxserver feature
issue.body:
This is a fix for: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/issues/46506

This change makes the substitution that prevents use of ` JMX#createProxy ` conditional. The substitution should only be enabled if the `jmxserver` feature is not included in the image build.

issue.title: Refactor jmxserver detection in native executable build
issue.body:
Avoids warnings without introducing a new configuration option

Closes https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/issues/46692
Reverts/Supersedes https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/46592
Fixes https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/issues/46506
